Reviews.Title: Samsung 22 inch TV Review
Reviews.Author: George
Reviews.Content: I use the tv in front of my treadmill and it's great in all respects except that I would have liked a little more volume from the speakers.  The3 sound is certainly clear enough on the news programs that I watch.  I just wish it had 10% more volume

Reviews.Title: Defective Out Of The Box
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I can see how this could be a really nice TV at a decent price.  I read the reviews and figured this set would meet my needs.  Got it all mounted and connected in the bedroom, but when I turned it on there was a vertical green line from top to bottom, right about left of center.  Very disappointing, right out of the box.  This one will definitely go back.  I plan on trying another, hoping this was just a fluke.Defect aside, the design is nice, picture quality good and volume is ok once you make adjustments to the equalizer under menu options.  The higher equalizer settings should probably have been set as defaults on this TV right out of the factory.  I noticed a couple reviews commenting on the poor volume, but changing the settings makes a big difference.I also considered a 26-inch set, but the 22-inch turned out to be just the right size for the bedroom.If this set didn't have the problem with the vertical line, I would have given it four or five stars.  I'll try a replacement and see what happens.

Reviews.Title: Great picture!
Reviews.Author: C. Poutasse "cpfiber"
Reviews.Content: It's not 42+ inches but it's perfect for our needs.  Great picture and, of course, easy operation.  We have it on mounted on the wall in a bedroom used for a bedridden person.  Would definitely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: First HDTV
Reviews.Author: Q. Thornton "Angelic Q"
Reviews.Content: This is my first HDTV so I really can't compare it to other TV's. I just purchased this product about two weeks ago and I love it. I did lots of research for the size and if I wanted to go for a 120HZ instead of 60 HZ refresh rate. All the 120HZ were at a bigger size and I had a budget. I went with this one.Now I mostly use this HDTV for video gaming. I have an Xbox 360, PS3 and Wii. The Xbox 360 came with a HD Component plug but the PS3 didn't so I purchased a HDMI plug thinking it was a HD Component plug. Oh well. It worked fine with the tv. The TV has one HD component plug, a couple of USB ports, and one HDMI. My lack of research was in this area as I didn't think I needed more than one HDMI port. The HD cable box I had to get used an HDMI port therefore I would have to unplug/replug the PS3's HDMI whenever I want to play. Not too much of a hassle! lol.So out the box, I had a little trouble screwing the stand into the bottom of the HDTV. Perhaps it was my screwdriver, but it still took me more than an hour to screw the darn thing into it and it's not even that tight cause it wiggles around a little bit. They should have made the holes a little bigger I think.Setting up the HDTV to work with the many components was as smooth as butter. At the time I didn't have my cable box and only had my gaming systems so the option for the Air and Cable channels didn't work for me. To switch between components, all you do is press the source button on the remote and go to TV, Component, HDMI, and Media (for USB). My cable box was on HDMI and my Xbox 360 was on Component.The graphics look amazing. Again this is my first HDTV so I can't compare to others. I found that I could change the view size to that of widescreen or fullscreen (4:3 or 16:9 ratios). There were more options than that which is great! Also, there were cable channels in HD so that was even better! Game Mode isn't really a big deal. It comes on automatically when I play my games. It makes the screen a little darker at least that's all I can notice. And I turn it off when watching cable.I guess the only thing I can point out about the graphics is that when watching a movie in standard IT REALLY SHOWS its choppyness in the background especially with older movies. Not sure if there's an option to fix this. I could probably mess around with it.The sound of the HDTV is decent, and I guess because of the size and where you use the TV. I have a small room so it's prefect but if you're using it in let's say a master bedroom and you are playing a big action movie or so, you have to turn it up more than 70/100 to hear it well. There might be an adjust in the menu also for this, haven't played around with it much lol.As far as using it for pictures and music from a media player, I haven't used the HDTV for that yet. Once I do I'll edit this review. In the meantime, I think this HDTV is awesome for being my first one!Thanks for reading *(^^)*

Reviews.Title: Great value for the money
Reviews.Author: Sonny
Reviews.Content: Samsung flat screen was exactly what we needed for the kitchen area.  Perfect size, crisp picture and energy efficient.

Reviews.Title: Love Samsung!
Reviews.Author: Sharon Spuganich "pug lover"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a new flat screen for my bedroom - I have a Samsung HD in my livingroom and love it so I went with this one - it is great! The picture is sharp and it is just the right size for a bedroom. Started loving it as soon as I hooked it up!

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN22c350
Reviews.Author: chief
Reviews.Content: Purchased to replace an analog TV that was installed high on a wall in a bedroom to view from the bed.  When viewed close to the TV, the colors are darkened and distorted.  This could be overcome by tilting the TV more downward but Samsung instructions limit the tilt to 15 degrees.  So TV can only be enjoyed with your head far from the TV (or almost perpendicular to the screen).  Otherwise buy was a good one.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Small Television
Reviews.Author: Mikul "Anomolicious"
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting too much from a small television that fits low on Samsung's rungs, but this TV performed much better than I expected. The picture is clear and bright. There is no distortion with fast moving images. It looks wonderful.The downsides? As said elsewhere, the volume isn't loud. It isn't quiet, but if you're looking for a theatre experience or need to drown out a room full of kids, you'll need amplification. The screen is plenty bright if the power-saving features are turned off. Once you add the power-saving, it's too dim for anything except a perfectly dark room.

Reviews.Title: Great for the Price
Reviews.Author: M. Ruelens "Moclvland"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV for the kitchen.  Excellent picture quality.  I do agree with what others have said about the volume being a little low.  Even after adjusting the equalizer, I usually have to have the volume 3/4 of the way to max.  But not enough of a problem not to recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Nice and clear
Reviews.Author: VisualFish
Reviews.Content: It is a nice and clear TV. I bought it to place it by my work station so I can watch DVDs or play some xbox games after I finish doing illustrations. The volume is a -bit- quiet but since I am right beside it I don't notice unless I am out of the room. My only complaints are the buttons on the TV itself, and how the image gets a tad darker if you view the screen a little to the left or right. Like most new televisions you can't see the buttons on the TV screen and are forced to use the remote. I am one of the few people who like to use the buttons on the TV, especially when I got it set up so close beside me. But this is really a minor thing. The television is nice, projects good and clear images and I haven't had a problem with it.

Reviews.Title: Poor Sound Quality
Reviews.Author: lovecats4 "sac68"
Reviews.Content: I am extremely disappointed in this television.  The audio is tinny.  Rather than return it, I am forced to buy a sound bar to enhance the quality of the audio.  This is the second Samsung TV I have purchased from Amazon.com, so I expected the same quality in this one as the previous t.v.  Disappointed.

Reviews.Title: HDTV
Reviews.Author: Joan L. Erlanger
Reviews.Content: Picture is quite clear except for shadows when watching tennis--the lines had shadows on both sides.  Like the light weight and smaller chassis.  Dislike having to use 2 remotes to operate--perhaps you can lay this at the feet of my cable provider.  All in all, a big improvement over our previous TV.

Reviews.Title: a good buy
Reviews.Author: Richard F. Chapman
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is excellent. Price is too. I would give it 5 stars, buy could stand to have more audio output. Sometimes I have to turn it all the waqy open to hear it. Most of the time it is adequate.

Reviews.Title: nicd extra tv
Reviews.Author: T. Stickler
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV to put in the guest bedroom.  Perfect size.  Nice picture and sound.  Easy to 'assemble.'  Would recommend this product.  Price was within reason and delivery was quick.

Reviews.Title: Great Flat Screen
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd Samsung flat screen TV and we are sold.  We originally bought a 46 inch for the living room and I recently bought the 22 inch for my craft room.  Finally got it hooked up today and I am very impressed with the HD.  My only complaint is that these HD TV's really need to come with the HD cable so you don't have to buy one after your purchase.  I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 for that reason.  I would definitely recommend the Samsung flat screen.  The 22 inch is great for a small area like a craft room, although I wish I had purchased the 26 inch.  The price for the 22 inch was great from Amazon and I think it is good product worth recommending.

Reviews.Title: OK I guess.
Reviews.Author: Billy Five "Billy 5"
Reviews.Content: I had just received a Samsung 46" backlit set and ordered this smaller TV for the bedroom.  I can definitely see the difference with the absence of backlitness.  So to be fair, had I not had the bigger set to compare to, this set is fine for a small room.  If you have a larger backlit set though you'll frown at the comparison.  Great price with Prime shipping.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: R.A.B.
Reviews.Content: I just recently bought this tv in the last 60 days the picture quality on this 22 inch is totally awesome one of the richest color 22 inch tvs i have seen so far but there is one down fall to this tv is the speakers the sound isnt that great above all Id have to give this tv a 4.75 out of 5 stars

Reviews.Title: Samsung 22' Tv
Reviews.Author: Weezie58
Reviews.Content: Love the TV.  Has great color & sharp picture.  Very easy setup.  Bought for our camper and is the perfect size.

Reviews.Title: On/Off switch design flaw
Reviews.Author: Robert H. Smith
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV because it has an on/off switch.  We set our TV to go off at 1am and on at 6:45am. After installing it, we discovered that when using the TV connected to an HD receiver, it goes off at the proper time and comes on at the proper time,except that all you get is snow on the picture and need to use the TV remote to change the source back to HDMI/DVI.  When I contacted Samsung they said the on/off switch does not work with HDMI/DVI.  They make no apology and just say that is the way the set is designed.  Having said that, the picture is great in HD.  If you just want HDTV and don't care about the on/off switch, this is a fine set at a reasonable price.  However, if you do rely on the on/off timers as we do, and on the manufacturer's design integrity, you'd best look at other brands.
